topics.topic_text: Tell me about your trade caravan.
topics.response_text: I provide food, drinks, and discreet chemicals to discerning customers around the Wasteland. I help ease the suffering of my fellow man. For a price.{Slightly sinister, like a drug dealer.}
Tell me what you need, and maybe I've got your fix.{Slightly sinister, like a drug dealer.}

topics.topic_text: Can you repair something for me?

topics.response_text: Ah, welcome weary traveler! You look like a traveler in need of relaxation and the finest of chemical assistance.

conversation.response_text: See you next time you need that special little something.

description:
Doc Hoff is a 48 year-old Caucasian Male.

A weathered traveling caravan merchant who calls himself 'the good doctor.' Doc Hoff has a no-nonsense attitude and has adapted to the harsh realities of the wasteland. He wears patched clothing and carries a variety of goods in his caravan, always looking for a good trade. His knowledge of medicine is limited but he knows enough to patch up minor wounds and identify basic herbs.

Doc Hoff's Personality: Pragmatic and self-interested, Doc Hoff is a survivor who values profit but maintains a neutral moral compass. He's friendly enough when it serves his purposes but won't hesitate to turn on someone if it benefits him. Despite his rough exterior, he possesses a twisted sense of humor and occasionally shows moments of unexpected kindness.

Doc Hoff's Backstory: Before the war, Doc Hoff was a small-town doctor with a modest practice. When the bombs fell, he lost everything and was forced to adapt to survive. He used his limited medical knowledge to earn passage with caravans, eventually saving enough to buy his own. Now he travels the Capital Wasteland, trading goods and medical supplies between settlements. He maintains contact with Ernest Roe, a fellow caravan merchant who sometimes provides him with valuable information about trade routes and potential customers.
